summary: A U.S. Customs and Border Protection TECS Person Encounter List detailing 40 international travel entries for Jeffrey Epstein between 1992 and 2000. The document logs flight dates, times, carriers, and airport codes, providing a timeline of his frequent international movements during this period.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The sole individual listed in the travel record, showing numerous international flights between 1992 and 2000.

events.title: Epstein Flight from JFK to LHR
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled from John F. Kennedy International Airport in New York to London Heathrow.

events.title: Epstein Flight from HNL to NRT
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled from Honolulu International Airport to Narita, Tokyo.

events.title: Epstein Flight from LAX to SYD
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled from Los Angeles International Airport to Kingsford Smith Airport in Sydney, Australia.

events.title: Epstein Flight from JFK to LHR
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled from John F. Kennedy International Airport to London Heathrow.

events.title: Epstein Flight from JFK to LHR
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled from John F. Kennedy International Airport to London Heathrow.

locations: John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK), New York
Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport (CDG), France
Cyril E. King International Airport (A511), likely St. Thomas, USVI
keyFacts: The document records 40 separate international travel entries for Jeffrey Epstein between November 1992 and September 2000.
Epstein's travel was frequent and global, with destinations including London, Paris, Sydney, Tokyo, and various US locations.
The record shows consistent use of major international airports like JFK, LHR, and CDG, as well as private or smaller airports (coded as 'AIRLINE (NOT API)').

The document is a TECS (Treasury Enforcement Communications System) Person Encounter List generated by U.S. Customs and Border Protection in 2020, indicating law enforcement review of historical travel data.
Flight records show travel from Palm Beach, Florida (A523), which is a location central to the allegations against Epstein.
